preserving-human-agency-ai-era.description: How we can maintain meaningful human control and decision-making power as AI systems become increasingly capable, and why agency preservation may be the defining challenge of the AI revolution.

designing-ai-user-interfaces-that-foster.author: Magnus Eriksen
designing-ai-user-interfaces-that-foster.title: Designing AI User Interfaces That Foster Trust and Transparency
designing-ai-user-interfaces-that-foster.description: We need transparency and ethical design choices to create experiences that clearly show how algorithms work, how systems handle data, and how AIs make decisions—all while addressing concerns such as users’ skepticism, fear of automation, and privacy needs.

explainable-ai-ensuring-design-decisions.author: Adam Fard
explainable-ai-ensuring-design-decisions.title: Explainable AI: Ensuring Design Decisions are Transparent and Accountable
explainable-ai-ensuring-design-decisions.description: Explainable AI (XAI) is an evolving field that seeks to demystify the inner workings of artificial intelligence models. In essence, XAI aims to make AI decisions transparent and understandable to humans. This is particularly crucial in design, where decisions can significantly impact user experiences and business outcomes.

ai-ux-design-creating-transparency-trust.author: Nitin Agarwal
ai-ux-design-creating-transparency-trust.title: AI UX Design: Creating Transparency & Trust in AI Products
ai-ux-design-creating-transparency-trust.description: Ever felt frustrated using an AI product that feels like a black box? You’re not alone. Users crave clarity—knowing why an AI makes certain decisions builds confidence and trust.

human-centered-design-for-ai-enhancing-u.author: Nitin Agarwal
human-centered-design-for-ai-enhancing-u.title: Human-Centered Design for AI: Enhancing UX of ML and Transparency
human-centered-design-for-ai-enhancing-u.description: Ever felt frustrated interacting with AI that just doesn’t get you? If AI interfaces confuse more than help, it’s often because they lack a human touch. That’s where Human-Centered Design for AI comes in. By focusing on real people’s needs and experiences, we can radically improve AI’s UX of ML, boost transparency, and tackle bias handling head-on. Ready to transform your AI interfaces? Let’s dive deep into what makes HCD essential for AI success.

human-in-the-loop.author: Agentic Design
human-in-the-loop.title: Human-in-the-Loop
human-in-the-loop.description: Strategic integration of human judgment at critical decision points in AI workflows

human-in-the-loop-design-when-ai-needs-a.author: Sean Brennan
human-in-the-loop-design-when-ai-needs-a.title: Human-in-the-Loop Design: When AI Needs a Teammate
human-in-the-loop-design-when-ai-needs-a.description: Great AI doesn't always mean full automation. Learn how to design workflows where humans intervene at the right time for quality, ethics, or trust.

how-to-be-the-designer-in-the-ai-loop.author: Darren Yeo
how-to-be-the-designer-in-the-ai-loop.title: How to be the designer in the AI Loop
how-to-be-the-designer-in-the-ai-loop.description: Exploring the evolving relationship between humans and AI in product design

ai-assistance-in-enterprise-ux-design-wo.author: Darren Yeo
ai-assistance-in-enterprise-ux-design-wo.title: AI assistance in enterprise UX design workflows: enhancing design brief creation for designers
ai-assistance-in-enterprise-ux-design-wo.description: The study explores the impact of AI tools on the daily tasks of designers in corporate environments, with a focus on the creation and evaluation processes of design briefs. Given ChatGPT’s advanced natural language processing capabilities and its potential to meet the complex communication and analysis needs of design work, this tool was selected to investigate its application in designers’ workflows.

ai-transparency-through-design-5-practic.author: Kateryna Mayka
ai-transparency-through-design-5-practic.title: AI Transparency Through Design: 5 Practical Lessons from the Field
ai-transparency-through-design-5-practic.description: AI transparency isn’t just about algorithms — it’s about design. This article explores five practical lessons from Eleken designer Julia Haievska’s work on the AI marketing platform Aampe, showing how thoughtful UX decisions make AI systems more understandable, reliable, and ethical. You’ll learn how to visualize AI behavior, guide users through complexity, build trust through communication, support learning by doing, and adapt transparency as your product evolves.

artificial-intelligence-shapes-how-we-th.author: Lennart Ziburski
artificial-intelligence-shapes-how-we-th.title: Artificial Intelligence shapes how we think, feel and behave. It drives the decisions that define our future.
artificial-intelligence-shapes-how-we-th.description: We have the responsibility to use this potential for humane technology. Building an AI based on our diverse values and needs requires thoughtful design.

ux-must-alleviate-the-cognitive-burden-o.author: Jakob Nielsen
ux-must-alleviate-the-cognitive-burden-o.title: UX must alleviate the cognitive burden of time
ux-must-alleviate-the-cognitive-burden-o.description: Next-generation AI-UX design must deliver human handoff harmony, with seamless transitions between machine execution and user cognition that recognize people’s limited mental processing budgets across different time periods. Includes 23 UX design patterns that support cognitive latency.

achieve-better-ux-and-design-usability-b.author: Katarzyna Łanecka
achieve-better-ux-and-design-usability-b.title: Achieve better UX and design usability by reducing cognitive load
achieve-better-ux-and-design-usability-b.description: This blog explains how minimizing cognitive load​​ and burnout improves user experience and design usability faster.

user-experience-design.author: Yvonne Earnshaw, Andrew A. Tawfik, & Matthew Schmidt
user-experience-design.title: User Experience Design
user-experience-design.description: The principles of HCI and UCD have implications for the design of learning environments. While the LIDT field has historically focused on learning theories to guide design.

the-effect-of-interface-consistency-and-.author: Jeremy Mendel
the-effect-of-interface-consistency-and-.title: The Effect of Interface Consistency and Cognitive Load on User Performance in an Information Search Task
the-effect-of-interface-consistency-and-.description: Although interface consistency is theorized to increase performance and user satisfaction, previous research has found mixed and often non-significant results. The source of this discrepancy may be due to varying levels of task difficulty employed in these past studies.

rethinking-ai-anthropomorphism.author: Yingwei (Wayne) Xu, Christina G. Chi, Dogan Gursoy, Ruiying (Raine) Cai
rethinking-ai-anthropomorphism.title: Rethinking AI anthropomorphism: A holistic conceptualization and scale across AI systems and service contexts
rethinking-ai-anthropomorphism.description: Building on Gestalt theory, this research introduces a holistic framework for defining artificial intelligence (AI) anthropomorphism, which guides the development of a parsimonious Scale of AI Anthropomorphism (SAIA).

designing-for-responsible-trust-in-ai-sy.author: Q. Vera Liao, S. Shyam Sundar
designing-for-responsible-trust-in-ai-sy.title: Designing for Responsible Trust in AI Systems: A Communication Perspective
designing-for-responsible-trust-in-ai-sy.description: With the popularity of complex AI systems used to augment or automate tasks that can affect many people’s lives and have a long-lasting impact, trust is often cited as a key requirement for people to adopt AI technologies.

ai-transparency-in-the-age-of-llms.author: Q. Vera Liao, Jennifer Wortman Vaughan
ai-transparency-in-the-age-of-llms.title: AI Transparency in the Age of LLMs: A Human-Centered Research Roadmap
ai-transparency-in-the-age-of-llms.description: The rise of powerful large language models (LLMs) brings about tremendous opportunities for innovation but also looming risks for individuals and society at large.

let-me-decide-increasing-user-autonomy.author: Lior Fink, Leorre Newman, Uriel Haran
let-me-decide-increasing-user-autonomy.title: Let me decide: Increasing user autonomy increases recommendation acceptance
let-me-decide-increasing-user-autonomy.description: The use of algorithm assistance for decision making is vastly increasing in recent years, largely in online settings wherein users receive advice from recommendation systems.

on-the-purpose-of-meaningful-human-contr.author: Jovana Davidovic
on-the-purpose-of-meaningful-human-contr.title: On the purpose of meaningful human control of AI
on-the-purpose-of-meaningful-human-contr.description: Meaningful human control over AI is exalted as a key tool for assuring safety, dignity, and responsibility for AI and automated decision-systems.

meaningful-human-control-over-ai-systems.author: Maria Luce Lupetti, Evgeni Aizenberg, Niek Beckers, Arkady Zgonnikov, Herman Veluwenkamp, David Abbink, Elisa Giaccardi, Geert-Jan Houben, Catholijn M. Jonker, Jeroen van den Hoven, Deborah Forster, Reginald L. Lagendijk
meaningful-human-control-over-ai-systems.title: Meaningful human control over ai systems: Beyond talking the talk
meaningful-human-control-over-ai-systems.description: How can humans remain in control of artificial intelligence (AI)-based systems designed to have autonomous capabilities? Such systems are increasingly ubiquitous, creating benefits - but also undesirable situations where moral responsibility for their actions cannot be properly attributed to any particular person or group.

four-principles-of-explainable-artificia.author: P. Jonathon Phillips, Carina A. Hahn, Peter C. Fontana, Amy N. Yates, Kristen Greene, David A. Broniatowski, Mark A. Przybocki
four-principles-of-explainable-artificia.title: Four Principles of Explainable Artificial Intelligence
four-principles-of-explainable-artificia.description: We introduce four principles for explainable artificial intelligence (AI) that comprise fundamental properties for explainable AI systems. We propose that explainable AI systems deliver accompanying evidence or reasons for outcomes and processes; provide explanations that are understandable to individual users; provide explanations that correctly reflect the system’s process for generating the output; and that a system only operates under conditions for which it was designed and when it reaches sufficient confidence in its output.

scope-services-when-in-doubt.author: Microsoft
scope-services-when-in-doubt.title: Guideline 10: Scope services when in doubt
scope-services-when-in-doubt.description: Engage in disambiguation or gracefully degrade the AI system’s services when uncertain about a user’s goals.
